basics.name: Halil Bozdogan
basics.label: Senior DevOps Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced Senior DevOps Engineer with a strong background in software engineering, infrastructure automation, and cloud-native transformations. Skilled in building scalable systems, optimizing CI/CD pipelines, and managing containerized applications on Kubernetes. Proven record of improving performance, reliability, and developer productivity across complex environments.

work.name: Nesine
work.summary: Senior DevOps Engineer at Nesine, the largest legal online betting provider in Turkey, leading modernization and automation initiatives across CI/CD, observability, and infrastructure.
highlights: Led the full migration from VM-based deployments to Kubernetes using Docker Buildx (Bake), Octopus Deploy, TeamCity, and custom deployment automation scripts.
Implemented and managed Octopus Kubernetes Agents, enabling environment-specific deployments and streamlined release processes.
Deployed and integrated GitLab Kubernetes Runners with Docker Buildx, providing isolated, scalable, and pod-based CI/CD execution.

Developed New Relic dashboards for real-time visibility into system performance and reliability, monitoring high-traffic services processing up to 70K requests per second across 4–8 pods (3 CPU / 4 GB each).
Built custom NGINX reverse-proxy deployments for microservices to enhance caching, routing, and centralized logging.
Developed a Blazor-based internal monitoring application to track Octopus Deploy pipelines and TeamCity build statuses.
Deployed and configured self-hosted Sentry for frontend teams to monitor and debug React applications effectively.
Integrated SonarQube with TeamCity pipelines to enforce Quality Gates and ensure build integrity based on static analysis results.

work.name: Enocta
work.summary: Senior Software Engineer focusing on backend performance, CI/CD improvements, and modernization of internal development practices.
highlights: Identified and resolved performance issues in core Web API services.
Designed and implemented new features to support multi-timezone operations for international users.
Migrated source control from TFS to Git, improving development collaboration and productivity.
Implemented CI/CD pipelines on Azure DevOps to automate build and release workflows.

work.name: Tiga Bilgi Teknolojileri A.S.

Modernized legacy .NET Core applications by migrating from 2.x to LTS versions.
Optimized large and complex codebases to improve performance and maintainability.
Established CI/CD workflows with TFS and on-premises Kubernetes clusters.
Containerized Windows Service applications using Docker and deployed to Kubernetes.
Led code quality and security reviews to ensure compliance with internal and external standards.

work.summary: Senior Software Engineer contributing to secure, high-performance systems for defense and government clients.
highlights: Developed a high-performance non-blocking web server for custom messaging integrations.
Obtained security clearance for classified military projects.
Collaborated closely with clients to design resilient, scalable systems.

highlights: Administered Windows Server and Active Directory infrastructure.

projects.name: National Health System - e-Nabiz
projects.summary: National health platform collecting and serving patient treatment data and healthcare information across Turkey.
highlights: Collected patient treatments and visits from healthcare providers across Turkey.
Displayed laboratory results, prescriptions, and treatment details to individuals via the e-Nabiz portal.
Handled over 1 million daily requests from healthcare providers.
Stored over 6 million patient data entries in a NoSQL (Couchbase) database with more than 20TB capacity.
Operated 150+ servers running Couchbase clusters with a high-availability setup serving the e-Nabiz Portal.
Integrated with internal and external systems, including diagnostic imaging services.
Migrated legacy Windows Service applications to Docker containers.
Configured key Kubernetes components, including MetalLB, NGINX-Ingress, and Harbor Registry.
